main event: Several observers reported sighting a bright, oval-shaped object in the sky over Springville, New York on August 7, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as hovering and performing sudden, erratic maneuvers before accelerating and rapidly disappearing from view.
The object appeared to be metallic in nature and emitted a bright, pulsating light.
It was estimated to be approximately 50-75 feet in diameter and hovered silently at an altitude of around 2,000 feet.
The attached diagram appears to be a radar plot or other technical data related to the reported sighting, showing an unidentified target exhibiting unusual flight characteristics.
Without additional physical evidence, the exact nature and origin of the object cannot be conclusively determined.
